means: 损伤外观，丑化，使失面子( deface的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: We crept into our little sister's bedroom and spitefully defaced her pop posters.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们偷偷溜进妹妹的卧室，不怀好意地把她的歌星宣传画涂脏。

sentence.Network_en: Scribbled pictures and remarks have defaced the pages of the book.
sentence.Network_cn: 乱画的图画和注解使那书上的书页无法阅读.

sentence.Network_en: The applicant must retrun the defaced certificate to HKEx for cancellation.
sentence.Network_cn: 申请人须将损毁证明书退回香港交易所予以注销.

list.abs: scars defaced her cheeks .伤疤损害了她的容貌.
skateboard 滑板defaced property 损毁的公物congregate 聚集
2. 结案陈词途污了的国旗defaced flags-
chalk marks deface the wall of the house ., 粉笔痕迹破坏墙壁的外观.

entry.tran: 损伤…的外观;在…上乱涂乱画
entry.def: If someone defaces something such as a wall or a notice, they spoil it by writing or drawing things on it.

example.tran: 在钞票上乱涂乱画是违法的。

means.word_mean: 1. having the surface damaged or disfigured

auth_sentence.content: Every religion...will be more or less defaced by error.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every religion...will be more or less defaced by error.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every religion...will be more or less defaced by error.

auth_sentence.content: Posters in Ramallah with Mr. Obama's face on them were defaced.
auth_sentence.res_content: Posters in Ramallah with Mr. Obama's face on them were defaced.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Posters in Ramallah with Mr. Obama's face on them were defaced.
